sections.content: The Challenge: Build a Healthcare Platform That Doesn't Just 'Work', But 'Complies'

The market didn't need another generic telehealth app. It needed a platform that could handle the regulatory complexity of 48 distinct jurisdictions while feeling as simple as buying a t-shirt. My goal wasn't just to ship code; it was to build a 'compliance engine' that enabled business velocity.

We faced a complex data modeling challenge: How do you handle recurring prescriptions, one-off lab kits, and annual membership fees in a single checkout flow without creating a tangled mess of dependencies?

sections.title: The Solution: 3-Tier Order Architecture
sections.content: Instead of patching a standard e-commerce model, I designed a 3-tier hierarchy: 'Master Order' (the patient's intent), 'Sub-Orders' (fulfillment units), and 'Line Items' (SKUs). This allowed us to split a single checkout into multiple downstream workflowsâ€”sending the lab kit to the lab, the prescription to the pharmacy, and the membership to the billing engineâ€”all asynchronously.

Doctors were frequently misrouting prescriptions because the UI didn't match their mental model. This wasn't a 'training issue'; it was a design failure. I observed their workflow and realized they needed guardrails, not just dropdowns.

sections.title: The Fix
sections.content: I built the 'Pharmacy Bridge'â€”a middleware logic layer that automatically filtered pharmacy options based on the patient's state and the medication type. We didn't just ask doctors to 'be careful'; we made it impossible for them to make a mistake. Result: Zero routing errors at launch.
